example.eg: The space agency launched another rocket into space at 6 AM.
example.egtrans: 太空署凌晨六点向太空发射了另一枚火箭。

example.eg: The shipyard will launch the new boat next week.
example.egtrans: 造船厂将于下周让新船下水。

example.eg: The company will launch its new product on Wednesday.
example.egtrans: 星期三该公司将推出新产品。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 推出, 发布, 发行

example.eg: The ship will launch at three o'clock, so you'd better be on time.
example.egtrans: 船会在3点正启航，你最好准时到达。

example.eg: The launch went as planned and the rocket is now in space.
example.egtrans: 发射按计划进行，火箭已经进入太空。

example.eg: The billionaire took the launch out to his yacht.
The rocket's launch time is 1400 hours.
The publisher held a launch party for the author's new novel.

dsense.name: launch
dsense.guideword: (product: be put on the market) (商品等)

example.eg: The product will launch on Tuesday.
They launched the expedition into the uncharted jungle.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 开始, 上路, 启程

example.eg: The commander gave the order to launch the torpedoes at the enemy ship.
He launched the ball towards the goal from thirty metres away.

dsense.name: launch an attack, launch an attack on [sth/sb]

example.eg: Prepare to launch an attack, men.

dsense.name: launch an attack, launch an attack on [sth/sb]

example.eg: The newspaper article launched an attack on the president and his policies.
After seeing the beggar, he launched into a speech about poverty.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 积极投入, 热情地开始

dsense.name: launch pad, launchpad, launching pad
dsense.guideword: (platform for launching a spacecraft) (火箭、导弹等的)

example.eg: The Space Shuttle is on the launch pad and the countdown to blast-off has begun.
He used his six months as a kitchen assistant as a launch pad to his career as a chef.

dsense.name: window, launch window
dsense.guideword: figurative (period for launching spacecraft) (火箭、飞船等)

example.eg: They have a six-hour window in which to launch the rocket.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最佳发射时段, 发射窗口
